Asthma affects more than your lungs. It affects your sleep, focus, energy, and daily routines. You may deal with wheezing, coughing, chest tightness, or shortness of breath with no clear warning. Some days are fine. Other days feel like you are trying to breathe through a straw. This app is built to help you take control.

This asthma tracker helps you monitor symptoms, medication use, triggers, and peak flow readings in one easy-to-use system. Whether you have mild asthma or are managing frequent flare-ups, this app gives you the clarity and consistency needed to manage your condition with more confidence.

SYMPTOM TRACKING  
Log daily symptoms like chest tightness, shortness of breath, coughing, wheezing, and fatigue. Track morning and evening separately if needed. Record symptom severity, duration, and frequency so you can see how your condition changes over time.

INHALER AND MEDICATION REMINDERS  
Set reminders for controller medications, rescue inhalers, steroids, or other asthma treatments. Stay consistent with timing and dosage. Log each use and mark if taken early, on time, or missed. Refill reminders help prevent running out at the wrong moment.

PEAK FLOW AND LUNG MONITORING  
Track your peak expiratory flow rate (PEFR) over time using a manual input or connected device. Record daily readings, track variability, and flag low zones. Over time, spot when your lung function is declining and respond before a full flare-up begins.

IDENTIFY TRIGGERS  
Log known or suspected triggers like dust, pollen, smoke, mold, exercise, stress, cold air, or illness. Track environmental data or weather patterns that may affect your breathing. Use custom notes to describe where symptoms occurred and what may have caused them.

SEE WHAT’S WORKING  
Compare medication use and peak flow with symptom trends. Use visual charts to understand how well your current plan is working. Share this data with your doctor, nurse, or care team to make more informed decisions together.

APPLE HEALTH INTEGRATION  
Sync sleep, step count, heart rate, and other data from Apple Health to understand how asthma is affecting your overall wellbeing. Review how flare-ups relate to sleep loss or stress to help reduce future risk.

PREP FOR YOUR NEXT APPOINTMENT  
Export logs as PDF or CSV to bring to appointments. Give your provider a detailed, time-stamped history of symptoms, inhaler use, and peak flow readings. No more guessing or relying on memory.

WHO THIS IS FOR  
- Adults and children managing mild to severe asthma  
- Parents tracking symptoms and meds for their child  
- Teens managing school, sports, and medications  
- Adults tracking work-related or seasonal flare-ups  
- Anyone wanting more insight into their breathing patterns

FEATURES  
- Asthma symptom tracker for wheeze, cough, breathlessness, and fatigue  
- Medication reminder for controller meds, inhalers, and steroids  
- Inhaler use log with time-stamped entries

The Pediatric Asthma Risk Score (PARS) is the first continuous scoring system for predicting asthma risk in young children.

By answering just 6 simple questions about eczema, wheezing, race, sensitization status and parental asthma history, families and clinicians are able to determine a child’s personal risk of developing asthma.
 
App Created by Gregory Hill at Cincinnati Children's Hospital Medical Center

aとbの条件を両方満たしている場合は、内蔵気圧計のデータが優先されます。

aの自動入力はOpenWeatherMap(http://openweathermap.com/)のサービスを利用しています。GPSの位置情報から最寄りのステーションのデータを取得しますが、近くにOpenWeatherMapのステーションがない場合、少し離れた地点のステーションからデータを取得しますので、自動入力された気候データに誤差が生じる場合があります。天気等が明らかに違う場合は、必要に応じて修正をしてください。
何らかの理由により、OpenWeatherMapからの気象データ取得に失敗した場合には、気象庁のアメダスからのデータ取得を行います(日本国内のみ)。ただし、アメダスはOpenWeatherMapよりも観測地点が少ないため、OpenWeatherMapよりも現在地との誤差が大きくなる可能性があります。
気象データ取得元の情報は、ピークフロー入力フォームの一番下に表示されます。
